title: What are some peppy percussion music? - Quora

response.answer_text: You should check out the album “Bridge Music” by Joseph Bertolozzi. It's all percussion, it's mostly peppy (there are one or two somber ones), and has a coolness factor of “being composed for and played entirely on an actual bridge.” Not like he played the music on a bridge, he played the actual bridge. So cool.

Most percussion instruments are incapable of playing music, and merely augment it. So first we must choose a percussion instrument that’s capable. Possibilities include the Piano, Xylophone, Marimba, Hammered Dulcimer, Santir, Cimbalom and Steel Drums. You could probably play Polkas, Tarantellas or ragtime music on nearly all of these.
